description: Borrowed from Italian modiglione. Doublet of moellon.

entries.meaning: (architecture) A decoratively carved supporting block atop a column.
examples: The familiar classic console or modillion is an example: although in general contour it is well adapted to its function as a supporting bracket, embedded in, and projecting from a wall, yet the scroll-like ornament with which its sides are embellished gives it the appearance of not entering the wall at all, but of being stuck against it in some miraculous manner.
